title.narrative: 2015182 - Integrated Services of Safe Migration, HIV Prevention and Care for Migrant Workers and Families – (Phase-II) (CARAM Asia)

description.narrative: Four key objectives (revised frame): 1. Enhance access to services forces HIV positive migrants a. Database deported migrants: strengthening their access to services and base for advocacy (AMAL) b. PPPs: by developing working groups to increase access for new HIV pos migrants- reducing stigma and discrimination (AMAL) c. Develop data disaggregation tools for better referral and testing data compilation (CDS) d. Establish referral system with health professionals. Access to services migrants and returnees (OKUP and CARAM Cambodia) e. Eradicate stigma and discrimination: sensitization hospital staff (AMAL and Caram Cambodia) f. Three multistakeholder workshops on sensitization and awareness migrants rights (OKUP) g. Trainings to overcome challenge unemployment for returnees as major cause of inaccessibility health services (AMAL, OKUP) h. Establish support committee HIV pos migrants and family at community level (Caram Cambodia) 2. Prevention new infections a. Pre departure orientation HIV prevention for potential migrants (AMAL, OKUP, CDS) b. Educating officers local governments on hiv (CDS) c. Creation website in national languages of Sinhala and Tamil, migrant specific (CDS) d. Produce needs based country specific information and awareness raising materials on HIV prevention (OKUP) e. Counseling and referral for volunteer testing of returnee migrants (AMAL) f. Mobilization of national CSOs working on HIV to strengthen capacity provision health services and advocacy efforts (AMAL) 3. Capacity building a. Workshops to enhance CSOs knowledge on HIV, SRH issues of migrants (CDS) b. CB workshop for HIV pos migrants on health rights, human rights and access to legal and welfare services (OKUP) c. Six CB trainings for peer facilitators outreach education (CARAM Cambodia) d. CB HIV pos nework representing ISP Nneeds (AMAL) e. CB Embassy personell on HIV and migration issues - to provide services to migrants in destination countries (ACHIEVE)

Policies and Laws regulating immigration in destination counties, mostly comprising of Single Entry Policy (no sex, pregnancy, marriage and/or children), are chaotic and built upon the concept of a short-term remedy for labour shortage problems, with migrants’ health being neglected. Separation from familiar social and cultural norms, substandard living- and exploitative working-conditions, resulting in isolation and stress, may lead migrant workers to engage in behaviours which increase HIV risk. CARAM and member organisations will advocate for the formulation of migrant-friendly national policies, whilst engaging with other relevant sectors to influence migrants accessibility and affordability of health services and focus on empowering migrants on prevention to reduce risk behaviour and new HIV infections.

RCNF Outcomes Enhancing HIV response implementation Human rights advocacy
1. To enhance migrants accessibility to HIV services, prevention, treatment, care and support, by reducing stigma and discrimination and developing coordination among health service providers, NGOs working on HIV issues, HIV networks, government departments and by providing referral and counselling services in project duration and beyond.
2. To advocate for prioritizing positive migrant workers issues in the formulation and implementation of HIV and AIDS policy frameworks at regional and national level as well as protection of HIV positive migrant’s human rights, by building capacity of government sectors and sensitizing policy makers gradually by approaching bottom to top hierarchy in three years and beyond project duration.
3. To build the capacity of relevant actors from government and private sectors to enhance effective HIV response in project duration.
Through these objectives, CARAM Asia aims to contribute in enhancing HIV response implementation and do human rights advocacy in line with RCNF outcomes.

sector.narrative: 2015182 - Integrated Services of Safe Migration, HIV Prevention and Care for Migrant Workers and Families – (Phase-II) (CARAM Asia) Human rights
